Title: AMMUNITION FOR RIFLE

Speaker: Sir WILLIAM LYNE
Title: AMMUNITION FOR RIFLE
text: As honourable members opposite had begun to direct attention to the state of the Committee, I did not care to run the risk of a count-out. In the circumstances, the responsibility for our not proceeding further to-night must Government lie with the Opposition.

Speaker: Mr JOSEPH COOK
Title: AMMUNITION FOR RIFLE
text: Parramatta) [11.15] - The last statement made by the Acting Prime Minister is as unfair and unjust as any that has ever been made in this Chamber. Since the Government announced their intention to proceed with the vote for the small arms and ammunition factory no word has been said on this side. All the talking has been on the Ministerial side of the Chamber. For the Acting. Prime Minister to say now that the responsibility for not passing this item must rest on members of the Opposition is as unfair as his statements generally are. - Sir WILLIAM LYNE - When the Opposition Whip called attention to the state of the Committee, it was time to report progress.

Speaker: Mr JOHNSON
Title: AMMUNITION FOR RIFLE
text: Lang) [n.i6].^-As there seems to be a determination to keep honourable members here to unreasonable hours at night, I wish to know whether it would not be possible to improve the ventilation, of the Chamber.

Speaker: Mr FISHER
Title: AMMUNITION FOR RIFLE
text: The whole building should be blown up.

Speaker: Mr JOHNSON
Title: AMMUNITION FOR RIFLE
text: During the whole, or the greater part, of the sitting, the atmosphere has been abominable, its foulness being distinctly noticeable when one enters it after having been 'in the outer air for a short time. It is cruel to ask us to breathe such an atmosphere for hours at a stretch.

Speaker: Mr THOMAS
Title: AMMUNITION FOR RIFLE
text: I call attention to the state of the House. [Quorum formed.']

Speaker: Mr JOHNSON
Title: AMMUNITION FOR RIFLE
text: Personally , I find that if I remain in the Chamber for a couple of hours continuously, I suffer from violent headaches, and several other honourable members have complained to me of similar ill effects.

Speaker: Mr SPEAKER
Title: AMMUNITION FOR RIFLE
text: Prio r to this session, complaints about the bad state of the air in this Chamber were very frequent, but, just before the meeting of Parliament, very considerable alterations were made, and tests which have been applied by the placing of thermometers in different parts of it show that until to-night the new system has worked admirably. If anything has gone wrong this evening, it is beyond my knowledge and experience, but I shall know tomorrow morning whether there has been any failure. I am sure that it is the desire of all the members of the House Committee to do everything possible for the convenience of honourable members. Question - resolved iri the affirmative.
